value: Then thesaid to Moses, âNow you will see what I will do to Pharaoh: Because of my mighty hand he will let them go; because of my mighty hand he will drive them out of his country.â
God also said to Moses, âI am the.
I appeared to Abraham, to Isaac and to Jacob as God Almighty,but by my name theI did not make myself fully known to them.
I also established my covenant with them to give them the land of Canaan, where they resided as foreigners.
Moreover, I have heard the groaning of the Israelites, whom the Egyptians are enslaving, and I have remembered my covenant.

âTherefore, say to the Israelites: âI am the, and I will bring you out from under the yoke of the Egyptians. I will free you from being slaves to them, and I will redeem you with an outstretched arm and with mighty acts of judgment.
I will take you as my own people, and I will be your God. Then you will know that I am theyour God, who brought you out from under the yoke of the Egyptians.
And I will bring you to the land I swore with uplifted hand to give to Abraham, to Isaac and to Jacob. I will give it to you as a possession. I am the.âââ
Moses reported this to the Israelites, but they did not listen to him because of their discouragement and harsh labor.
âGo, tell Pharaoh king of Egypt to let the Israelites go out of his country.â
But Moses said to the, âIf the Israelites will not listen to me, why would Pharaoh listen to me, since I speak with faltering lips?â
Now thespoke to Moses and Aaron about the Israelites and Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he commanded them to bring the Israelites out of Egypt.
These were the heads of their families:
It was this Aaron and Moses to whom thesaid, âBring the Israelites out of Egypt by their divisions.â
They were the ones who spoke to Pharaoh king of Egypt about bringing the Israelites out of Egyptâthis same Moses and Aaron.
Now when thespoke to Moses in Egypt,
he said to him, âI am the. Tell Pharaoh king of Egypt everything I tell you.â
But Moses said to the, âSince I speak with faltering lips, why would Pharaoh listen to me?â
